edu.csupomona.cs.cs141.thehouse

Class Shield

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.csupomona.cs.cs141.thehouse.GameObject
      • edu.csupomona.cs.cs141.thehouse.Shield
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<GameObject>

    public class Shield
extends GameObject
    This class represents the shield object, it will protect the Player from being stabbed by an Enemy for a set number of turns.
    Author:
    Kurt Newcomb, Andrew Nipp, Andrew Niklas, Ben Nickerson
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      This field represents the unique ID of the object, used for comparing two GameObjects

      This is the string for the name of the Shield.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Shield

        public Shield()
        Sets the name of the Shield on the grid

      • Shield

        public Shield(boolean vis)
        Sets the name and visibility of the Shield
        Parameters:
        vis - If true then it will change the name to SHIELD if not then it will set it to GameObject.getBlankName()

    • Method Detail

      • activateShield

        public void activateShield(Player ply,
                           int m)
        Activates the shield for the player
        Parameters:
        ply - Calls the Player.setHasShield(boolean) and sets it to true, it also calls Player.setM(int) to the amount of turns
